<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
DAZ: Oeno, I have seen your scroll detailing the issues you encountered in your time using the voyager stones. (My thanks once again for helping to test this new technology!)
2 1
DAZ: To your first observation: the memory storage systems allow one voyager (per mask) to remain on standby when disconnected, returning them to that exact position when reconnected.
3 2
DAZ: This allows Nomai disconnected from their voyager to quickly return to voyages far from the projection pool!
4 3
DAZ: However: it appears the system currently fails to discern between the original host, and any new Nomai who voyage to the same destination (from the same projection pool.)
5 4
DAZ: As a result, if a previous Nomai leaves a voyager waiting on standby, a new Nomai using the voyager stone will be connected to it, inheriting its location.
6 2
DAZ: Furthermore, as a result of this connection to a previous individual's voyager, the voyager then becomes connected to both memory masks.
7 6
DAZ: I suspect that is likely what caused your experiences to be streamed to Coleus' memory mask.
8 7
OENO: How illuminating! It appears there is still much work to complete on this budding, but very promising technology.
9 8
OENO: In this case: until these issues can be amended, Coleus and I shall simply be mindful of disposing of our voyagers, to avoid unwittingly sharing voyages with each other!
